message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the concept of capacity for noisy computations, which involves information theory and communication channels. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the reliability of computations, which involves error-correcting codes and cryptography, making cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) a likely sub-category as well. The analysis of the stability properties of the perfect function and the random channel suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the proposal to apply the models to formal computational models suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) could also be a possible sub-category.
